report_title: Emergency & Other Outpatient Care Centers in the US
executive_summary: Emergency and outpatient care centers have developed a fast-growing role in healthcare delivery in the United States. While rising incomes and broader insurance coverage have facilitated access to outpatient care in recent years, rising healthcare costs, declining reimbursements and tech advances have moved more procedures to the outpatient setting. The shift to outpatient care continued despite the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, with the pandemic permanently changing how patients receive care.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An Aging Population Facing Health Challenges Propels Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The demographics of the patient population have fostered industry growth. Demand for outpatient care is increasing as the baby boomer generation ages, primarily because of the growing healthcare needs of older individuals. Specifically, there is a higher demand for procedures such as colonoscopy, orthopedic surgeries, eye treatments, and plastic surgeries among the aging population.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Free-standing emergency departments and ambulatory surgery centers (ASCs) are two of the fastest-growing areas in outpatient care.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: By 2023, ASCs have been performing more than half of all outpatient procedures – with the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid continuing to authorize more procedures for the outpatient setting.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Freestanding Surgery Centers a Lynchpin of the Industry's Expansion
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While COVID-19 initially limited elective medical procedures that many outpatient facilities depend on, the essential nature of treatment for health services has unleashed a wave of pent-up demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Government Payers Push Healthcare Toward Outpatient Care
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Medicare and other health insurance programs recognize that freestanding surgical centers are more cost-effective for outpatient surgery than hospitals, contributing to growth in the number of procedures performed in ASCs.
While COVID-19 initially limited elective medical procedures that many outpatient facilities depend on, the essential nature of treatment for health services has unleashed a wave of pent-up demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AGING POPULATION PUSHES DEMAND EVER UPWARD
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will continue to benefit from favorable demographic trends. Over the next five years, the number of US residents aged 65 and older is projected to grow more quickly than the total population.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MEDICARE PAYMENTS REMAIN FLAT, PRESSURING CARE CENTERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Medicare is also expected to undergo several changes due to healthcare reform and budgetary issues.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consolidation on the Rise in Response to Reimbursement Challenges
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: For some companies, such as dialysis centers, operating costs have risen faster than revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Technologies and Services Variety Drive Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technological advancements have expanded outpatient facilities services.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments with medical staff primarily providing emergency, general or specialized outpatient care. This industry also includes centers or clinics with various health practitioners, each with different specializations and operating in the same establishment.

opportunities: Number of adults aged 65 and older
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: A rapidly evolving healthcare landscape supports growth in outpatient care.
Outpatient care providers' role has implications for public health.
Government funding for dialysis boosts access.
Patient volumes at ambulatory surgery centers keep accelerating.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Other revenue sources vary widely but some include workers' compensation, payments for nonpatient care, donations and retail sales (medical supplies, over-the-counter medicine).
Private health insurance includes commercial insurance (PPO, HMO) and private health plans purchased directly or through a health insurance marketplace.
Government insurers include Medicare and Medicaid.
Out-of-pocket payments include payments by patients for medical care not covered by insurance.

products_and_services.product_description: The industry includes a wide variety of other centers, providing services such as biofeedback, infusion therapy, sleep disorder treatment and a variety of pain management treatments.
This segment provides a range of outpatient medical services to health maintenance organization (HMO) subscribers with a focus generally on primary healthcare.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Freestanding Ambulatory Surgical and Emergency Centers
products_and_services.product_description: Surgeries performed at freestanding ambulatory surgery centers (ASCs) do not require hospital admission.
Kidney dialysis centers provide services to patients with kidney disease.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Reimbursements from Private Insurance are Single-Largest Revenue Source
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private health insurance includes commercial insurance.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Public Insurance Reimbursements Fall as Pandemic-Era Rules Unwind
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Government insurers include Medicare and Medicaid.

business_locations.location_description: Disproportionate share of industry establishments in the Southeast.
The large number of outpatient care centers in the West is tied to its high population share.
High population density in Great Lakes region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Emergency and other outpatient care centers must obtain licensing.

barriers_points.barrier_description: A trained staff of clinical and nonclinical employees is necessary for patients to receive high-quality care.

basis_points.basis_title: Ambulatory surgery centers compete with hospitals
basis_points.basis_description: Ambulatory surgery centers face pressure from new ambulatory facilities operated by hospitals.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Emergency and other outpatient care centers is characterized by a high degree of fragmentation.

top_companies.company_name: Fresenius Medical Care AG & Co. KGaA

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Patient care includes the cost of drugs and other medical supplies.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Employees are the lifeblood of outpatient care centers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: OUTPATIENT MEDICAL CARE IS BECOMING THE STATUS QUO
volatility_points.volatility_description: Emergency and other outpatient care centers provide vital healthcare services.

FAQs.question: Has declining access to health insurance limited opportunities for your company?
FAQs.answer: Demand for healthcare services rises with increased access to health insurance.

FAQs.question: How does your company market its services to the wider community?
FAQs.answer: Outpatient care centers must follow all of the HIPAA criteria.
